title: Valter Butte
text: Valter Butte () is an ice-free butte on the east side of <a href="Schytt%20Glacier">Schytt Glacier</a>, about 5 nautical miles (9 km) west-northwest of <a href="Mount%20Schumacher">Mount Schumacher</a> in <a href="Queen%20Maud%20Land">Queen Maud Land</a>. It was mapped by Norwegian cartographers from surveys and air photos by the <a href="Norwegian-British-Swedish%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Norwegian-British-Swedish Antarctic Expedition</a> (NBSAE) (1949–52) and named for <a href="Stig%20Valter%20Schytt">Stig Valter Schytt</a>, second in command and glaciologist with the expedition.
